Package com.linecorp.armeria.server.file

Class HttpFileServiceBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.linecorp.armeria.server.file.HttpFileServiceBuilder
  • public final class HttpFileServiceBuilder
extends Object
    Builds a new HttpFileService and its HttpFileServiceConfig. Use the factory methods in HttpFileService if you do not override the default settings.

    • Method Summary

      • serveCompressedFiles

        public HttpFileServiceBuilder serveCompressedFiles​(boolean serveCompressedFiles)
        Whether pre-compressed files should be served. HttpFileService supports serving files compressed with gzip, with the extension ".gz", and brotli, with the extension ".br". The extension should be appended to the original file. For example, to serve index.js either raw, gzip-compressed, or brotli-compressed, there should be three files, index.js, index.js.gz, and index.js.br.

        Some tools for precompressing resources during a build process include gulp-zopfli and gulp-brotli, which by default create files with the correct extension.

      • maxCacheEntrySizeBytes

        public HttpFileServiceBuilder maxCacheEntrySizeBytes​(int maxCacheEntrySizeBytes)
        Returns the maximum allowed size of a cached file entry. The file bigger than this value will not be cached.

      • build

        public HttpFileService build()
        Returns a newly-created HttpFileService based on the properties of this builder.
